required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Efficacy and Safety of TAF vs Other NAs in Patients With LVL
clinical_study.official_title: The Efficacy and Safety of Tenofovir Alafenamide Fumarate Compared With Other Nucleoside Analogues (Acid) to Treat Patients With Low-level Viremia of HBV

lead_sponsor.agency: Third Affiliated Hospital, Sun Yat-Sen University

clinical_study.source: Third Affiliated Hospital, Sun Yat-Sen University

brief_summary.textblock: Patients with chronic hepatitis B should maximize the inhibition of HBV replication, which could reduce the incidence of liver cancer and liver disease-related complications. However, after 96 weeks of treatment with the first-line drugs, entecavir or tenofovir disoproxil fumarate, a certain proportion of patients still had low levels of HBV replication. Tenofovir alafenamide fumarate is a newly marketed anti-hepatitis B drug that is currently considered to be non-inferior to tenofovir disoproxil fumarate and safer bone and renal effects. Therefore, this research was put forward to investigate whether tenofovir alafenamide fumarate replacement for hepatitis B had a higher virological response rate and safety in patients with low levels of virus after 48 weeks of treatment with entecavir and tenofovir disoproxil fumarate.

detailed_description.textblock: Patients who meet the inclusion and exclusion criteria will be enrolled into the research. The participants will voluntarily choose to enter the experimental group or the control group with full informed consent. The control group will continue with the original regimen, while the study group will switch to tenofovir alafenamide fumarate antiviral therapy. Each group will enroll 100 participants.

primary_outcome.measure: Ratio of patients with undetectable hepatitis b virus DNA after treatment
primary_outcome.description: Hepatitis b virus DNA would be tested to know the ratio of patients with undetectable hepatitis b virus DNA at 24 week after treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: The changes of glomerular filtration rate
primary_outcome.time_frame: 0 week, 12 week, 24 week, 48 week, 72 week, 96 week, 120 week, 144 week
primary_outcome.description: Glomerular filtration rate will be tested to know the changes after treatment

primary_outcome.measure: The changes of bone mineral density in lumbar spine and hip
primary_outcome.description: Bone mineral density in lumbar spine and hip were tested after treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Ratio of patients with undetectable hepatitis b virus DNA after treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 week, 48 week, 72 week, 96 week, 120 week, 144 week
secondary_outcome.description: Hepatitis b virus DNA would be tested at 6 time points.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0 week, 12 week, 24 week, 48 week, 72 week, 96 week, 120 week, 144 week
secondary_outcome.description: The levels of HBsAg were tested at each time point.

secondary_outcome.measure: The changes of the degree of liver fibrosis
secondary_outcome.description: Fibroscan would be conducted once every 48 weeks

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0 week, 12 week, 24 week, 48 week, 72 week, 96 week, 120 week, 144 week
secondary_outcome.description: Symptoms would be evaluated at each time point

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0 week, 12 week, 24 week, 48 week, 72 week, 96 week, 120 week, 144 week
secondary_outcome.description: The levels of HBeAg were tested at each time point.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0 week, 12 week, 24 week, 48 week, 72 week, 96 week, 120 week, 144 week
secondary_outcome.description: The levels of alanine aminotransferase were tested at each time point.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0 week, 12 week, 24 week, 48 week, 72 week, 96 week, 120 week, 144 week
secondary_outcome.description: Body weight would be evaluated at each time point

secondary_outcome.measure: Differences in proteinuria, albuminuria and urinary β2-microglobulin
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0 week, 12 week, 24 week, 48 week, 72 week, 96 week, 120 week, 144 week
secondary_outcome.description: Proteinuria, albuminuria and urinary β2-microglobulin would be evaluated at each time point

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0 week, 12 week, 24 week, 48 week, 72 week, 96 week, 120 week, 144 week
secondary_outcome.description: The levels of osmotic pressure would be evaluated at each time point

secondary_outcome.measure: Differences in blood calcium and phosphorus
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0 week, 12 week, 24 week, 48 week, 72 week, 96 week, 120 week, 144 week
secondary_outcome.description: The levels of blood calcium and phosphorus would be evaluated at each time point

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0 week, 12 week, 24 week, 48 week, 72 week, 96 week, 120 week, 144 week
secondary_outcome.description: The levels of blood lipid would be evaluated at each time point

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0 week, 12 week, 24 week, 48 week, 72 week, 96 week, 120 week, 144 week
secondary_outcome.description: The levels of creatine kinase would be evaluated at each time point

arm_group.description: Patients will switch to tenofovir alafenamide fumarate treatment, 25mg，once a day
Patients will continue with the original regimen treatment, entecavir, 0.5mg once a day, or tenofovir disoproxil fumarate 300mg once a day

intervention.description: Patients would take tenofovir alafenamide fumarate, 25mg，once per day
Patients would take entecavir 0.5 mg once per day, or tenofovir disoproxil fumarate 300 mg once per day
